intro: Bopusia subintegra, commonly known as the smooth leaf bopusia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are smooth and glossy. The plant produces clusters of delicate, white or pale pink flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
